title: [$250] Narrow React Compiler dependencies in MoneyRequestReportNavigation

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771578295267569) ### Background: When a user opens an Expense Report from Search results, the app renders MoneyRequestReportNavigation — the component responsible for prev/next navigation between reports. This component subscribes to 8 Onyx stores via useOnyx hooks. On every render, it calls getSections() + getSortedSections() — a chain that iterates all search result data, builds report action lookup maps, extracts violations, resolves transactions per report, runs policy/payment/approval checks per entry, then sorts everything. The component re-renders on every Onyx store update, including updates unrelated to the search data. ### Problem: When a user navigates from Search results to an Expense Report, every Onyx store update re-triggers the full getSections computation chain on all re-renders, even when the search data hasn't changed, blocking the JS thread with redundant work during navigation. ### Solution: Extract the specific sub-fields needed by getSections into separate variables before the computation block. This narrows the React Compiler's dependency tracking from whole objects to individual fields, so the cache only invalidates when the actual inputs change. Expected Outcome: flow:  create expense fab → add amount → add merchant → create expense → navigate to reports - Reduce re-renders 265 to 249 (-16), render time across all components from ~5,157ms to ~4,178ms (-19%) - ManualOpenCreateExpense span reduced 479 ms->337 ms (-30%) Draft PR -> https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82785
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @bernhardoj

  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022024854081531117550
  • Upwork Job ID: 2024854081531117550

Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @OlimpiaZurek

title: [$250] Eliminate redundant sorting in LHN renderItem

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771486725240319) ### Background: The LHN renders a scrollable list of all user-visible reports via a FlashList renderItem callback. For each report row, renderItem derives several values from that report's actions: the last visible action, the last displayable action, the one-transaction thread report ID, and the last IOU money request action. Report actions are stored as unsorted objects in Onyx. A collection-level Onyx callback on ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_ACTIONS already fires on every data change and iterates over all report-action collections to maintain pre-computed caches (allSortedReportActions, lastReportActions, lastVisibleReportActions). Additionally, the reportAttributes OnyxDerived config already computes per-report metadata reactively whenever its Onyx dependencies change. ### Problem: When the LHN re-renders on a heavy account, each renderItem call independently performs two sort operations, a filter pass, and a find scan over that report's actions, which slows down initial navigation to the inbox and degrades scroll frame rates as the number of reports grows ### Solution: 1. Expose oneTransactionThreadReportID through the existing reportAttributes OnyxDerived config which already computes it but was discarding it so renderItem reads it reactively instead of calling getOneTransactionThreadReportID() per item. 2. Merge the .filter() and .find() passes in the REPORT_ACTIONS collection callback into a single for loop with early break, caching results in lastVisibleReportActions and lastVisibleIOUMoneyActions. 3. Replace the two per-item sort calls with a single-pass findLastReportActions() using an isNewerReportAction comparator, reducing per-item complexity [Draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82648) Performance gain: ManualNavigateToInboxTab span reduced ~30ms
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @sobitneupane

title: Update date search filters to use `Start` and `End`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1771519965997709


**What the problem is:**
NewDot date filters are labeled After and Before, which is unintuitive for users trying to set an inclusive date range (they may need to enter the day before the intended start date).

**What the expected output is:**
Rename the date filter labels to Start and End to match user expectations for setting a date range.

**Requirements**
Make sure this text is updated for all date filters, including the advanced search filters rhp, and the exposed filters
All we need to change in the actual query is changing the operator from using `<` and `>` to `<=` and `>=`

So `date>2025-12-01` would be come `date>=2025-12-01`


<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @QichenZhu</details>

body:
### Problem
When a user opens the app, if Sentry spans don't start until JS is loaded, then we don't have visibility into how long it took the native code to initialize.

### Solution
Start Sentry from native.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.22-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Beamanator **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771423107647349) ## Action Performed: 1. Create a new account 2. Do not explicitly name the workspace 3. Allow Harpoon email to trigger (after a few days) 4. Observe subject line. ## Expected Result: If no proper workspace name exists, the subject should gracefully fall back to a cleaner default, such as: Which expenses do you want to review ? Avoid email addresses as workspace names. ## Actual Result: Subject line displays: Which expenses do you want to review on your xyz@gmail.com's Workspace workspace? ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.22-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @linhvovan29546 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771424204393179)

## Action Performed:

1. Resize the browser window to a narrow width (small screen breakpoint)
2. Hover over the Account button
3. Observe background and icon color change
4. Hover over the Workspace button
5. Observe no background change and no icon color update.

## Expected Result:
No hover effects should appear on small screens for any tabs.
## Actual Result:
Account tab shows hover background + icon color change.
Workspace tab does not show hover styling.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: Sage Intacct export fails due to hidden expense missing Multi-Entity Location

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** (Needs Reproduction) Reproduction blocked - Unable to export due to error message
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @JamieMcElroy
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771457600004919)

## Action Performed:

1. Logs into [new.expensify.com](http://new.expensify.com/)
2. Creates or opens a report containing multiple expenses
3. Attempts to export report to Sage Intacct
4. Export fails with an error: “Failed Sage Intacct export due to a missing Multi-Entity Location”
5. Checks all visible expenses in New Expensify – all show valid Locations
6. Switches to Classic
7. Identifies hidden expense line missing Location
8. Populates missing Location in Classic
9. Re-exports report – export succeeds

## Expected Result:
All expenses, including hidden or system-generated lines, should be visible in New Expensify
Any missing required fields (like Multi-Entity Location) should be clearly indicated
Export or submission should be blocked with an actionable error message before reaching Intacct
Users should not need to switch to Classic to resolve required field issues
## Actual Result:
Export fails with Intacct error
All visible expenses in New Expensify appear valid
Hidden expense line with missing Location is not visible/editable in New Expensify
User must switch to Classic to identify and correct the missing Location
After correcting in Classic, export succeeds
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos
